title: zenaku
author: zenaku
content: Well, with the deferncia of exchange 2 usd for the first world is actually derisory, for a third world country it is good for sweets.As I mentioned in the title, I sell everyday videos of what it's like to live in a third world country.What do I offer? Get to know videos about guerrilla warfare, harassment, indigenous cultures, rains, floods, traffic, culture and how economic exchange is.I do not provide personal information.My country is so third world that coffee is sold on the street, a cart and what to sell its price is from 0.1 to 0.2 usd...I have more data and videos

comments.author: NotATether
comments.body: Well I don't know about you, but people can see coffee and a bunch of other stuff being sold pretty much on the streets of nearly every 3rd world country, because there are large bazaars just for that.I don't see a really compelling reason for people to buy such video data. Why not simply post it on Youtube in that case?

comments.author: zenaku
comments.body: It is a very good question!Uploading a 15-second video to YouTube with a title "la cultura de mi pais" or "la vendedora de tintos" implies creating content.I am not a content creator, therefore I do not want to censor, I want to show the pure and hard reality and have contact with whoever watches the video, explain contexts and use sociology and history to explain the phenomena.I add that the service I offer is not just a video, it is transmitting sensations.I ask myself this questionWould a foreigner in my country know these things? I'm sure he would be very VERY shocked.

comments.author: CryptSafe
comments.body: OP, I guess this videos of yours you want to sell is a bit into the documentations or documentaries about the third world country which I believe it to be Africa and it is possible you are an African by origin. So tell me is it the peanut you would get here selling some videos that would exposeÂ  your country to the world as a nothing for good kind of countries. I think OP you are being insensitive about what you are doing to your people and your country as well.

comments.author: IIrik11
comments.body: Quote from: zenaku on April 18, 2023, 12:36:32 PMIt is a very good question!Uploading a 15-second video to YouTube with a title "la cultura de mi pais" or "la vendedora de tintos" implies creating content.I am not a content creator, therefore I do not want to censor, I want to show the pure and hard reality and have contact with whoever watches the video, explain contexts and use sociology and history to explain the phenomena.I add that the service I offer is not just a video, it is transmitting sensations.I ask myself this questionWould a foreigner in my country know these things? I'm sure he would be very VERY shocked.did u not record these videos u r selling yourself?if not, who records them and how did u find these?also, as the other person suggested, why not upload them to youtube?u do know that youtube has 'shorts' where u can upload small videos of 10-15 seconds..and once your channel gets popular, u might be able to monetize it..or maybe the reason ur not uploading it because u know that it would plagiarism?but if u have rights and u still don't want to upload them and only sell them..then u'd have to at-least show previews, so that someone interested would buy them.

comments.author: LoyceV
comments.body: Quote from: zenaku on April 18, 2023, 11:57:43 AMGet to know videos about guerrilla warfare, harassment ~Which country is this?

comments.author: examplens
comments.body: Quote from: IIrik11 on April 18, 2023, 01:32:11 PMu do know that youtube has 'shorts' where u can upload small videos of 10-15 seconds..and once your channel gets popular, u might be able to monetize it..If everything is correct as he says about the country he is from, it is quite realistic that any monetization is not possible there. Can you imagine that Google operates normally where there is guerrilla warfare, harassment, and normal daily routine?Quote from: IIrik11 on April 18, 2023, 01:32:11 PMor maybe the reason ur not uploading it because u know that it would plagiarism?Even if it wasn't plagiarism, he would have to have permission from all the people in the video to publish it. Maybe his country doesn't care about it, but Google sure does.

comments.author: Cantsay
comments.body: Quote from: LoyceV on April 18, 2023, 01:57:29 PMQuote from: zenaku on April 18, 2023, 11:57:43 AMGet to know videos about guerrilla warfare, harassment ~Which country is this?I guess this is it; according to his first post since I'm not familiar with his language I used Google translate and it turned out to be Colombia.Quote from: zenaku on February 28, 2023, 05:48:57 PM~~~Soy de colombia, saludos!!!!Translated to: I'm from Colombia, greetings!!!!

comments.author: zenaku
comments.body: The videos are recorded by me. I don't think they understand my idea. The reason is that you users ask anything about my country. Example: how do red wine vendors work and what is it like to consume it in the street, sitting on a platform? I record the video with the requested information, details without compromising other people. Another example, how is the transport system? -The system is by collective buses and you have to put your hand out to make it stop, there are no specific stops, and to stop the vehicle you yell stop. I don't understand why they think I'm going to compromise my country or its citizens, I just want anyone here to explore it in a foreign body. It could be called a remote guide. My country is really beautiful, it has impressive things for someone from the first world. Regarding YouTube or other platforms, it is not indicated. That is precisely what btc is for, so as not to have intermediaries saying that it is good or not. This is supply and demand. My service is not expensive and I am open to dialogue, I also have an English translator (real-time, human translation). PS: I have to show something, of course I do. What would you like to see, following the example above.

comments.author: CryptSafe
comments.body: Quote from: zenaku on April 18, 2023, 03:12:16 PMThe videos are recorded by me. I don't think they understand my idea. The reason is that you users ask anything about my country. Example: how do red wine vendors work and what is it like to consume it in the street, sitting on a platform? I record the video with the requested information, details without compromising other people. Another example, how is the transport system? -The system is by collective buses and you have to put your hand out to make it stop, there are no specific stops, and to stop the vehicle you yell stop. I don't understand why they think I'm going to compromise my country or its citizens, I just want anyone here to explore it in a foreign body. It could be called a remote guide. My country is really beautiful, it has impressive things for someone from the first world. Regarding YouTube or other platforms, it is not indicated. That is precisely what btc is for, so as not to have intermediaries saying that it is good or not. This is supply and demand. My service is not expensive and I am open to dialogue, I also have an English translator (real-time, human translation). PS: I have to show something, of course I do. What would you like to see, following the example above.Can you please tell us your country and a little about it because I believe from their it would arouse people's interest in your services since you have said it is not about compromising your people or putting them at risk.Start with a brief of your country, then back it up with some pictorial excerpts from these places you have mentioned so prospective clients would envision how it looks like there by contacting you for your services. If you do it well you will be surprised to get turnups for your services.Remember "what is worth doing is worth doing well".

comments.author: virasog
comments.body: Quote from: zenaku on April 18, 2023, 11:57:43 AMWell, with the deferncia of exchange 2 usd for the first world is actually derisory, for a third world country it is good for sweets.As I mentioned in the title, I sell everyday videos of what it's like to live in a third world country.What do I offer? Get to know videos about guerrilla warfare, harassment, indigenous cultures, rains, floods, traffic, culture and how economic exchange is.I do not provide personal information.My country is so third world that coffee is sold on the street, a cart and what to sell its price is from 0.1 to 0.2 usd...I have more data and videosThe idea is good, but the problem is that there are vlogs channels from almost every country available on youtube. You search for a place and you will get a vlog for that country. I don't think how you can produce a video that may give a lot of views unless someone really needs them for documentary purposes.Quote from: zenaku on April 18, 2023, 03:12:16 PMThe reason is that you users ask anything about my country. First things first, may we know which country you from ?

comments.author: Fiatless
comments.body: Quote from: zenaku on April 18, 2023, 11:57:43 AMWhat do I offer? Get to know videos about guerrilla warfare, harassment, indigenous cultures, rains, floods, traffic, culture and how economic exchange is.I do not provide personal information.My country is so third world that coffee is sold on the street, a cart and what to sell its price is from 0.1 to 0.2 usd...I have more data and videosYour services will be good for content creators that need these videos to generate revenue from various social media. I don't know how you intend to handle the copyright issue and I am wondering if your country is a wartorn and natural disaster-prone nation. I just wonder how you can get videos of harassment and battles because it will be very risky. But it also seems that OP has been working on this project for a long time which is why he could boast of having these videos. Anyway, I wish you all the best in your business.

comments.author: zenaku
comments.body: Quote from: virasog on April 18, 2023, 03:25:38 PMQuote from: zenaku on April 18, 2023, 11:57:43 AMWell, with the deferncia of exchange 2 usd for the first world is actually derisory, for a third world country it is good for sweets.As I mentioned in the title, I sell everyday videos of what it's like to live in a third world country.What do I offer? Get to know videos about guerrilla warfare, harassment, indigenous cultures, rains, floods, traffic, culture and how economic exchange is.I do not provide personal information.My country is so third world that coffee is sold on the street, a cart and what to sell its price is from 0.1 to 0.2 usd...I have more data and videosThe idea is good, but the problem is that there are vlogs channels from almost every country available on youtube. You search for a place and you will get a vlog for that country. I don't think how you can produce a video that may give a lot of views unless someone really needs them for documentary purposes.Quote from: zenaku on April 18, 2023, 03:12:16 PMThe reason is that you users ask anything about my country. First things first, may we know which country you from ?Most of those blogs are disastrous, I am a passionate historian. I seek to place you here, convey to you what it feels like and what is observed when living where I live. Added to that this is without censorship and expressing freedom of opinion without falling into ramblings and lies. As I already mentioned, tell me I want to see how a certain thing is and I make you understand, see and explain to you why it is so. I'm from Colombia (although I didn't want to mention it now, it was a surprise) I have found considerable acceptance and mixed opinions, I like that. I agree to have introductory material for this weekend, stay tuned! Your comments make me understand many things, including what you would like to see. Thank you for your kindness and keep proposing. A big hug, I really appreciate the kindness of the comments.

comments.author: cabron
comments.body: People from 3rd world countries are really not conscious that it's funny to have coffee in paper cups for sale on the streets. In India, people are making mud cups for the coco milk they sell on the streets. quite rare that it's not what other countries do and after every drink, the customers have to break the cup they use. That's something rare. But why would people buy these sorts of videos? it's a rare fetish.Â  What people want to see in Colombia I think are the ancient structures from the old civilization there like the Omlec or the Mayan. That's one interesting topic actually.

comments.author: LoyceV
comments.body: Quote from: zenaku on April 18, 2023, 04:32:02 PMMost of those blogs are disastrous, I am a passionate historian. I seek to place you here, convey to you what it feels like and what is observed when living where I live.You'd probably get more viewers if you share some of your previous videos. As an example: I like this: it shows she has skills (and in her later videos she has a much better camera, Youtube must pay good).

comments.author: Rizzrack
comments.body: This reminds me of a video I saw a while back: https://youtu.be/A_yEnZlZFnMÂ   good luck !

comments.author: Aikidoka
comments.body: Quote from: Rizzrack on April 18, 2023, 07:20:07 PMThis reminds me of a video I saw a while back: https://youtu.be/A_yEnZlZFnM Â  good luck !That was actually cool, changing someone's life, or even multiple people's lives, from poverty to wealth would be incredible. This Liberian man in the video asked for electronic devices, but ended up getting an actual job. I really like watching these types of videos.For the OP, try to share some of vids you made in here and I wish you a good luck!

comments.author: coin-investor
comments.body: So the guy is from Columbia but there are so many videos on Youtube about Columbia and you can be specific on what you want to see on Columbia, in fact, there are some vloggers that are dedicated or exploring Columbia like this one Gone too deep in Cali, Colombia! ð¨ð´so what's the difference and what can your videos offer that will not see on Youtube, it's better if you just upload it on Youtube, and if it's really interesting it will get a lot of views and subscribers and you can eventually monetize it.

comments.author: lucifur
comments.body: Quote from: LoyceV on April 18, 2023, 04:56:38 PMQuote from: zenaku on April 18, 2023, 04:32:02 PMMost of those blogs are disastrous, I am a passionate historian. I seek to place you here, convey to you what it feels like and what is observed when living where I live.You'd probably get more viewers if you share some of your previous videos. As an example: I like this: it shows she has skills (and in her later videos she has a much better camera, Youtube must pay good).Youtube money sucks unless you get a decent partnership to get ads running in your channel.I think I understand what OP is trying to sell. They are selling the experience you get in being in that third world country and just like you guys said, I think it will be much better on a documentary videos.I've seen vloggers do these experiences in other countries as well and they are indeed not that great. I view it as them chasing clout with the ridiculous things they do in a foreign country which many locals don't even really do.IMO, since you mentioned that you are a passionate historian, you can just sell your service as a tour guide of some sort for foreigners wanting to visit your country. You can show them the videos you have as examples of what you can help them experience during their stay in your country.

comments.author: UmerIdrees
comments.body: Quote from: cabron on April 18, 2023, 04:51:47 PMPeople from 3rd world countries are really not conscious that it's funny to have coffee in paper cups for sale on the streets. In India, people are making mud cups for the coco milk they sell on the streets. quite rare that it's not what other countries do and after every drink, the customers have to break the cup they use. That's something rare. But why would people buy these sorts of videos? it's a rare fetish.Â  What people want to see in Colombia I think are the ancient structures from the old civilization there like the Omlec or the Mayan. That's one interesting topic actually. I would call it a flop idea to start a channel of Vlog from a third world county. No one would like to see videos of these countries, rather people will love to watch vlogs of developed countries as those are the places where everyone loves to go and live their lives.I guess OP knows this, so that is why he didn't start any channel of his own, rather he is willing to make videos in case anyone still needs these videos of underdeveloped countries. By now, I don't see anyone looking to buy these videos, maybe he needs to try other platforms like Fiverr to sell his services.
